description: From Middle French palestre, from Old French, from Latin palaestra, from Ancient Greek παλαίστρα (palaístra, “wrestling school”).

entries.meaning: (historical) A public area in ancient Greece and Rome dedicated to the teaching and practice of wrestling and other sports; a wrestling school, a gymnasium. [from 15th c.]
examples: Athenian culture flourished in externalities, the open air of the agora and the nudity of the palestra.

entries.meaning: An arena for literal or figurative combat; a battlefield. [from 15th c.]
